intro: Staphidium petiolare, commonly known as the petiole staphidium, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Ericaceae. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in late spring or early summer. The plant has evergreen leaves that are elliptical in shape and have a leathery texture. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
